|action2=WAR |action2date=00:06, 30 December 2014 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/William of Wrotham |action2result=approved |action2oldid=639433518
|action3=FAC |action3date=2015-02-05 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/William of Wrotham/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=643878724 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography|living=no|class = FA|listas=William Of Wrotham|military-work-group=y|military-priority=Low}} {{WikiProject Middle Ages|class = FA|importance=low}} {{MILHIST|A-Class=pass|class = FA|Biography=yes|British=y|Medieval=y}} }}
==Wife== [http://www.theweald.org/d10.asp?BookId=HmH198 ''The History of the Parish of Hailsham, The Abbey of Otham and the Priory of Michelham''] p202 states that Joan de Kelle was the wife of William of Wrotham. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 20:31, 12 June 2016 (UTC) : However, more recent sources do not mention this and in fact, I believe this is a totally different William of Wrotham - since it mentions that the record of the wife is found in the [[Hundred Rolls]], which are from the later 13th century. They are at least 50 years past the death date of the subject of this article. [[User:Ealdgyth|Ealdgyth]] - [[User talk:Ealdgyth|Talk]] 20:53, 12 June 2016 (UTC)
